metadata.title: A Formal Theory of Commonsense Psychology: How People Think People Think
metadata.authors: Andrew S. Gordon and Jerry R. Hobbs
metadata.description: Chapter 46 axioms covering repetitive execution patterns, repeatUntil structures, body executions, termination conditions, iteration through sequences, and temporal progression of repetitive processes
metadata.notation: First-order logic with reified repetitive processes, temporal sequences, and iterative execution control

axioms.title: Definition of repeatUntil
axioms.fol: (forall (e e1 e2) (iff (repeatUntil e e1 e2) (and (eventuality e)(eventuality e1)(eventuality e2) (exists (s) (and (tseq s) (forall (e3 t) (if (member' e3 t s) (and (instance e3 e1) (atTime e3 t)))) (forall (t) (if (member t s)(not (atTime e2 t)))) (exists (t0) (and (ends t0 s)(atTime e2 t0)))))))
axioms.english: A repeatUntil eventuality e repeats action e1 until condition e2 holds. The repetitions form a temporal sequence s where each member is an instance of e1, e2 never holds during the sequence, and e2 holds at the end of the sequence.

axioms.title: Definition of body in repeatUntil
axioms.fol: (forall (e e1 e2 e3) (iff (body e1 e e3) (and (repeatUntil e e1 e2)(instance e3 e1))))
axioms.english: e3 is a body execution of e1 in repeatUntil e if e is a repeatUntil of e1 until e2, and e3 is an instance of e1

axioms.title: Definition of termCondition in repeatUntil
axioms.fol: (forall (e e1 e2) (iff (termCondition e2 e) (repeatUntil e e1 e2)))
axioms.english: e2 is a termination condition of repeatUntil e if e is a repeatUntil of some e1 until e2

axioms.title: Subevent relationship for body executions
axioms.fol: (forall (e e1 e2 e3) (if (and (repeatUntil e e1 e2)(body e1 e e3)) (subevent e3 e)))
axioms.english: If e3 is a body execution of e1 in a repeatUntil e, then e3 is a subevent of e

axioms.title: Definition of repeatUntilExecution
axioms.fol: (forall (e0 a e p) (iff (repeatUntilExecution' e0 a e p) (and (execute' e0 a e p)(repeatUntil e e1 e2))))
axioms.english: e0 is a repeatUntil execution by agent a of eventuality e in plan p if e0 is an execution of e by a in p, and e has a repeatUntil structure

axioms.title: Definition of repeatUntilPlanExecution
axioms.fol: (forall (e0 a p) (iff (repeatUntilPlanExecution' e0 a p) (and (executePlan' e0 a p)(exists (e e1 e2) (and (topGoal e p)(repeatUntil e e1 e2))))))
axioms.english: e0 is a repeatUntil plan execution by agent a of plan p if e0 is an execution of plan p by a, and the top goal of p has a repeatUntil structure

axioms.title: Body execution as subexecution
axioms.fol: (forall (e0 a p e e1 e2 e3 e4) (if (and (repeatUntilPlanExecution' e0 a p)(topGoal e p) (repeatUntil e e1 e2)(body e1 e e3)(execute' e4 a e3 p)) (subexecution e4 e0)))
axioms.english: If e0 is a repeatUntil plan execution, e3 is a body execution of the repeat body, and e4 is an execution of e3, then e4 is a subexecution of e0

axioms.title: Temporal ordering of body executions
axioms.fol: (forall (e0 a p e e1 e2 e3 e4 e5 e6 t1 t2) (if (and (repeatUntilPlanExecution' e0 a p)(topGoal e p)(repeatUntil e e1 e2) (body e1 e e3)(body e1 e e5)(execute' e4 a e3 p)(execute' e6 a e5 p) (atTime e4 t1)(atTime e6 t2)) (or (before t1 t2)(before t2 t1)(equal t1 t2))))
axioms.english: In a repeatUntil plan execution, body executions are temporally ordered - they occur either before, after, or simultaneous with each other

axioms.title: Definition of iterateThrough
axioms.fol: (forall (e s x e1) (iff (iterateThrough e s x e1) (and (sequence s)(forall (n y) (if (and (inSeq y n s)(instance e1 e)) (and (atTime e1 n)(arg* x e1)))))))
axioms.english: Event e iterates through sequence s with element x and event type e1 if s is a sequence, and for each position n with element y in s, there's an instance e1 of event type e at time n with x as argument

axioms.title: IterateThrough execution definition
axioms.fol: (forall (e0 a e p) (iff (iterateThroughExecution' e0 a e p) (and (execute' e0 a e p)(exists (s x e1) (iterateThrough e s x e1)))))
axioms.english: e0 is an iterateThrough execution by agent a of event e in plan p if e0 is an execution of e by a in p, and e has an iterateThrough structure

axioms.title: IterateThrough plan execution definition
axioms.fol: (forall (e0 a p) (iff (iterateThroughPlanExecution' e0 a p) (and (executePlan' e0 a p)(exists (e s x e1) (and (topGoal e p)(iterateThrough e s x e1))))))
axioms.english: e0 is an iterateThrough plan execution by agent a of plan p if e0 is an execution of plan p by a, and the top goal of p has an iterateThrough structure

axioms.title: Subevent relationship for iterateThrough executions
axioms.fol: (forall (e0 a p e s x e1 e2 e3) (if (and (iterateThroughPlanExecution' e0 a p)(topGoal e p) (iterateThrough e s x e1)(instance e2 e1)(execute' e3 a e2 p)) (subexecution e3 e0)))
axioms.english: If e0 is an iterateThrough plan execution, e2 is an instance of the iteration event type, and e3 is an execution of e2, then e3 is a subexecution of e0

axioms.title: Definition of startRepetition
axioms.fol: (forall (e0 a e p) (iff (startRepetition' e0 a e p) (and (repeatUntilExecution' e0 a e p)(exists (e1 e2 e3 e4) (and (repeatUntil e e1 e2)(body e1 e e3) (execute' e4 a e3 p)(first' e0 e4))))))
axioms.english: e0 is starting a repetition by agent a of event e in plan p if e0 is a repeatUntil execution, and there's a first body execution e4 that is the first subevent of e0

axioms.title: Definition of continueRepetition
axioms.fol: (forall (e0 a e p) (iff (continueRepetition' e0 a e p) (and (repeatUntilExecution' e0 a e p)(exists (e1 e2 e3 e4) (and (repeatUntil e e1 e2)(body e1 e e3) (execute' e4 a e3 p)(not (first' e0 e4))(not (last' e0 e4)))))))
axioms.english: e0 is continuing a repetition by agent a of event e in plan p if e0 is a repeatUntil execution, and there's a body execution e4 that is neither first nor last in the execution sequence

axioms.title: Definition of endRepetition
axioms.fol: (forall (e0 a e p) (iff (endRepetition' e0 a e p) (and (repeatUntilExecution' e0 a e p)(exists (e1 e2 e3 e4) (and (repeatUntil e e1 e2)(body e1 e e3) (execute' e4 a e3 p)(last' e0 e4))))))
axioms.english: e0 is ending a repetition by agent a of event e in plan p if e0 is a repeatUntil execution, and there's a last body execution e4 that is the final subevent of e0

axioms.title: Temporal progression in repetitive execution
axioms.fol: (forall (e0 a p e e1 e2 e3 e4 e5 e6 t1 t2) (if (and (repeatUntilPlanExecution' e0 a p)(topGoal e p)(repeatUntil e e1 e2) (body e1 e e3)(body e1 e e5)(execute' e4 a e3 p)(execute' e6 a e5 p) (atTime e4 t1)(atTime e6 t2)(before e4 e6)) (before t1 t2)))
axioms.english: In a repeatUntil plan execution, if one body execution occurs before another, then their times are also ordered - earlier executions occur at earlier times

axioms.title: Termination condition satisfaction
axioms.fol: (forall (e0 a p e e1 e2 t) (if (and (repeatUntilPlanExecution' e0 a p)(topGoal e p)(repeatUntil e e1 e2) (atTime e0 t)(ends t e0)) (exists (t0) (and (before t0 t)(atTime e2 t0)))))
axioms.english: In a repeatUntil plan execution, when the execution ends at time t, the termination condition e2 must have been satisfied at some earlier time t0

conversion_notes.reified_predicates: Extensive use of primed predicates for repetitive execution processes: repeatUntilExecution', repeatUntilPlanExecution', iterateThroughExecution', iterateThroughPlanExecution', startRepetition', continueRepetition', endRepetition'
conversion_notes.defeasible_reasoning: No axioms use (etc) condition - all repetitive execution definitions are strict logical relationships
conversion_notes.repetitive_structures: Comprehensive treatment of two main repetitive patterns: repeatUntil (condition-based termination) and iterateThrough (sequence-based iteration)
conversion_notes.temporal_integration: Sophisticated integration with temporal logic including temporal sequences, ordering constraints, and termination timing
conversion_notes.execution_framework: Builds on basic execution framework from Chapter 44 with specialized repetitive execution types
conversion_notes.cross_references: Integration with plan theory, execution modalities, temporal sequences, and event structure theory
conversion_notes.complex_quantification: Multiple axioms with nested quantification especially in repeatUntil definition, temporal ordering, and execution relationships
conversion_notes.hierarchical_structure: Clear distinction between basic repetitive structures and their execution by agents in plan contexts

file_format_notes.logical_structure: Mix of definitions, implications, and temporal constraints with high complexity concentration
file_format_notes.predicate_consistency: Consistent use of repetitive execution terminology with clear semantic distinctions
file_format_notes.defeasibility_markers: No defeasible rules - all repetitive logic is strict definitional relationships
file_format_notes.reification_patterns: Strategic reification of repetitive execution processes and control operations
file_format_notes.repetitive_framework: Systematic treatment from basic repeatUntil/iterateThrough structures through execution control to temporal progression
